description:
I definitely recommend we get a lot of Pizza from here now at work and I love the selections.  The Margherita is good.  One of my favorites is the Meatball Pizza it is awesome.   And the companies go to favorite is the New York Pesto Chicken Pizza.  

I've also tried the The Gourmet Pizza with the large artichokes.  Just convince your company to cater from here so you can try everything on the menu.
author: Homer S.

description:
This review is only for the happy hour which runs from 4-6 pm M-F as I've only been here a couple of times during happy hour. This has to be the cheapest happy hour deal in FiDi. You can get a slice of peperoni or cheese pizza and a drink for $6 with tax.

Their pizza is the New York style hand tossed thin crust pizza. To my surprise I found that it is really close to the original, but only when it is freshly made. I get a slice only if I see a new pie laid out as the reheated variety is not good. During happy hour they have a steady flow of new pies so most times I've managed to get a slice. There aren't too many choices for the beer. You can get a larger (Anchor Steam), pilsner or IPA (Racer 5). I generally get the IPA even though I'm not a fan of Racer 5. Service is hit or miss as I've found very friendly servers and completely standoffish ones here.

All things considered the freshly made pizza's here are good and comparable to the original. Happy hour is definitely good value for money while service can improve. 3.5 stars rounded up to 4 is how I'd rate this place.
author: Ahmad J.

description: The pizza here isnt bad by any means its your standard NY style but the prices are crazy for pizza. Everything in NYC is even more overpriced then here usually and they still do quality slices for a buck there. My friends back in NY would laugh at me if they knew I paid around 6 a slice for average pizza. I ordered the pesto and the supreme and no complaints flavor wise.
author: Sean G.

description: That counter girl that talks in a soft whisper needs to get fired. I witnessed her kick a paying customer out of their store over what appeared to be nothing. I might have missed something since I was eating my pepperoni slice and scrolling through my phone, but it's not the first time I have seen her act like she runs the place. Maybe she does run the place. Seeing as this place is one of the few places downtown that caters to the low income millennials during happy hour it's important I bring this up. Where will this 86'd girl find a $3 beer now!? Cause if I was 86'd I'd be screwed!
author: Natalie M.

description: I didn't know what to expect but destiny intervened.  Happy hour.  Pizza.  Beer.  Does life get any better in San Francisco?  I say not. This is it. The end of your destiny.  BTW, I loved both the beer and the pizza.
author: Mike C.

description: The pizza was ok...the service was kinda bad! I've seen this spot so many times, but finally went to lunch here. There seems to be some younger people behind the counter and maybe since they're used to serving the many construction workers a lot of them forgot how to properly serve someone. Guy behind the counter didn't say hello and just kinda waited for me to say something. So in return I was just the same back! Anywho I got a pepperoni pizza and overall it wasn't bad. Crispy and not too greasy. Decent pizza, but some terrible service if the service was a bit better this could be a solid spot since prices weren't too bad either ($5 bucks a slice!)
author: James R.

description: Had to order impromptu for a work party and this place came through with the basic pizza but without all the grease!  Went with the basics; pepperoni and olives, ham & pineapple and a combo.  We thought we may have ordered too much as these pizza are rather large; however, we only had 2 remaining slices of pizza left... So good!
author: Aaron H.

description:
I came here for a quick lunch and quickly regretted it. I should have known better with all the good choices nearby. This is not San Francisco level quality at all.

Let me first say that the staff is incredible- efficient, attentive, and service oriented.  What they have to work with is where it begins to falter.

Lots of pizza choices. There was a line and I didn't notice anyone ordering anything else even though the menu board lists salads and other options. Most were taking out. You order at the counter, pay, and get your food...then sit down at a spot or leave.

I ordered a slice of mushroom and a slice of pesto. They heated both and the wait wasn't long, but I have to say that the presentation of pizza choices was unappealing. 

The pizza was average at best, and I'm wondering why slices of potato were on my mushroom pizza? The pesto pizza was very greasy and lots of oil dripped off it.

The place is gritty and dirty looking. Not much done to clean up as patrons leave. I blame management for that.

Needless to say I was remorseful when I left and saw that Belden Place was a half block away...oh well.
author: Tom B.

description:
Came here for a quick bite with my co-worker. She was craving pizza and I recall a pizza place nearby when I was running errands.

Pretty busy during lunch time, ordering was very quick and easy and they have a big menu inside. Got a slice of the West Side BBQ Chicken, it was ok, not amazing, but gets the job done. I would come here again if I was in a rush to get something cheesy to eat :)
author: Natalie L.

description: The pizza here is fresh, NY style and just pure yumminessss... Lucked up and found this running an errand after work on a empty stomach. The young lady at the counter was a sweetheart.
author: Miz A.

description: DO NOT EAT AT THIS PLACE!!! Hubby picked up pizza from this place and by the time he got home from work he was throwing up nonstop!! Based on some other reviews I read "they were handling money and grabbing the slices" and "one of them had a bandaid which was peeling off and grabbed the slice with his open cut" eeewww!! Gross! Wish we would've read the reviews prior to ordering. Now he has 100+ fever!
author: Deborah E.

description:
It was inevitable that I would try the pizza here sooner or later because the old Kurt Russell/John Carpenter classic "Escape from New York" has always been a guilty pleasure of mine.  Unfortunately, it wasn't exactly "A-Number-1"...

The pizza has a super thin crust, which was overcooked into a state of cracker crunchiness. The slice in general is extremely thin - only in Italy have I had such a thin pizza, but this is not wood fired pizza, nor is the sauce or mozzarella fresh and delicious. Don't get me wrong, I am not expecting Italian pizza in SF - I had more than my fill of the stuff in Italy.  What I was hoping for was a fuller slice, cooked properly, and well topped with awesomeness. 

Given my basic credo, i.e., "The worst pizza I've ever had is pretty darn good", then Escape from New York is OK for a slice or two. 

All things considered, there are plenty of better pizza places both in both Northern and Southern California.
author: Tom K.

description:
The hours here say open until 11.  Door front says closed at 7:30. No place to eat pizza slice in this neighborhood.  

Try the gyro shop across the street.
author: Alley C.

description: Okay pizza.   Good price for a slice and a small soda with coupons from the SF Weekly newspaper.  Close to work location for a short walk.  Great place for lunch under $5.
author: Arthur Y.

description:
Had a variety delivered to an office party. Tried the margherita first -- had to have been the worst margherita pizza ever, although in the spirit of "even when it's bad it's good," I had three slices.

The combo with pepperoni and sausage tasted better, but firmly average.

I asked my colleague (who had ordered everything) how much it cost. Each box was in the ballpark of $30. What the what?!?! Folks, even in SF you can get Domino's for $10. EFNY is better but nowhere close to 3 times better.

Delivery service was prompt and professional, for what that's worth, but I can't imagine personally paying for this pizza.
author: Barack O.

description: This was the worst pizza I ever had. No taste, no quality ingredients. It tasted just like a paper plate. I name it "escape from San Francisco" pizza and it's 5.50 for a tasteless slice! It's a miracle this place has survived.
author: Angelina P.

description:
I've had their pizza delivered and it's really average. Pretty greasy slices that I'd honestly only eat as drunk, late-night food. I'd go with better pizza elsewhere or something else for delivery. 

The pizza is definitely better when it's still warm. The moment it starts to cool, the cheese and crust harden and the pizza becomes those gross leftover slices you'd eat in college because you didn't know any better.
author: Jessie L.

description: We are from LA and every time we are in Frisco we have to get pizza from Escape from New York. The pizza is .com its nothing that we have back in southern california.
author: Natalie S.

description: As a native New Yorker living in the Bay Area, I'm always on the hunt for good pizza. While you shouldn't escape from NY to get authentic NY style pizza, Escape from New York gets pretty darn close. I've been to several locations - this one gets super busy at lunch and happy hour. Ample seating inside and out. They have some gourmet options, but I'm a classic pepperoni pizza gal. Delicious, not too thick, just the right amount of grease, and crispy crust. Best pizza in the Financial District, and in my opinion, the Bay Area!
author: Melissa M.

description:
I can honestly say this is the closest to NY pizza I've had in California, and I'm not big on making the comparison at every NY pizza place. Pizza stands alone to each establishment as "enjoyable" or "not worth it" for me.  

I initially passed on the mushroom slice for the fancy pants pesto/sliced potato/roasted garlic, and while it is pretty spectacular, we hung around a bit and I went in for it on slice #2. Holy crap. The crust on both slices was true to the style, down to the slight crunch of each bite. Their sauce works. I might have hurt myself on the two slices, but it was so worth it. 

Probably the best mushroom slice (at a by-the-slice place) I've ever had. Till next time...
author: Mari H.

description: These dudes totally hooked us up. Placed a very large order the day before and they got me into a lunch time slot that appeared full online. the web order was easy to do and the food was good. I'll be back.
author: Jason K.

description:
The pizza slice was decent. It is a little pricier per price than I would like. It's funny because all of the reviews talk about their great service but that's what I didn't like. The cashier/server was just on his phone the whole time. And after he was done with whatever on there, he took my order and then waited around to take my card too even after I already had my pizza. 

I came in an off-hour and expected to be in n out in 3 mins. Pretty sure it was around 10 with the amount of texting I waited for.
author: Eve C.

description: Not a single paper product or blow dryer in the bathroom last time I visited. How are employees washing/ drying hands properly if there's nothing in the bathroom to use? Escape the unsanitary conditions.
author: Bart H.

description:
Great pizza for a group event. By ordering through yelp, the process was super simple and the order was on time.  The pizzas were bigger than expected - ordered a variety from veggie, to Hawaiian, to meat deliciousness - all devoured by the attendees.

When I picked up the pizzas, they were still steaming and smelled amazing. 

On my way over, the driver of Lyft was even mentioned it was his favorite pizza place in the city - and he worked made Pizza for 3+ years over in the East Bay!

This team was professional, nice and 7/7 would order and eat here again.
author: Daniel S.

description:
Another entry in the "order food for work" series, where I look for ease of ordering, ease of delivery/pickup, and taste of the food (of course!).

Escape From New York has a really easy web ordering system, where you can pick the exact pizzas and the delivery time/location. Badabing, badaboom, they called at the appointed and hour delivered the pizza right to the meeting room.

I ordered:
- Cheese pizza
- You Say Potato pizza
- And Warhol pizza
- Veggie Combo pizza
- NY Pesto Chicken pizza
- Glorious Chicken pizza
- Small tray of spring mix salad

I made the mistake of ordering 6 x-large pizzas for a group of 20 people, and we ended up with only half of the pizza being eaten.  I guess that's better than under-ordering and not having enough, right?

Anyway, the pizzas looked great and there was good variety, the taste was just okay.  They all had great toppings, but just a bit under-seasoned and bready.
author: Nadeem A.

description: The pizza here is generally good. I usually order pepperoni or pesto. I love the pesto, it's my fav. The girls at the counter are pretty nice and when I realized they had the frequent customer cards, you know the ones they stamp- buy 9 slices get 1 free, I informed the girl at the front counter, I told her I come in often. She then immediately stamped a few of the boxes and kindly handed it to me. She was very friendly- it's too bad I didn't catch her name, but she had very short hair (from what I can remember). Someone stated in their review that this is a racist establishment. I'm black and they've always been nice and friendly. I also saw a black guy working there, so I highly doubt that claim. If you're ever in need of a bite to eat, I'd recommend this place. It's not the best pizza I've ever had, but it's good enough to satisfy a craving.
author: Dawn L.

description:
I and a Vegan, used to order vegan pizza from another store, and decided to give ESNYP a try.  I ordered pizza with Daiya Cheese (fake cheese), basil and mushroom.  That was such a tasty pizza, with generous amount of cheese and fresh ingredients.  Even my non-vegan relatives love this pizza.

The guy took the order on the phone was very nice.  Definitely will go again very soon.
author: Yf W.

description:
Really wanted to like this place, as I've heard their pizza is great. A friend and I walked in at lunch time and were pleasantly surprised there wasn't a long line. When the girl serving pizza asked us what we'd like, I asked for two slices of pepperoni - she proceeded to take two slices of pizza and put them on plates, handing them to me. My friend then asked for the same, and the woman responded with "sorry, i've already sold the rest of these". It was a bit off putting, though my friend kindly asked for a slice of the pesto pizza.

While we stood in the same line waiting to pay at the register, the man behind us ordered a couple slices of pepperoni and the same girl happily served the man the pizza. We were a bit confused, because the same woman had just told my friend the pizza was already sold.

Nonetheless, I proceeded to pay for the 2 slices of pizza and a fountain drink. The total was $13. Seems a bit pricey for quick service, mediocre pizza at best. The best part of the experience was the cream soda from the soda fountain.

Might give this spot another try one day, but for now I can say there is definitely other pizza spots in the area I'd prefer.
author: Nick S.

description: 0 customers in the pizzeria waiting for food. So not busy.  Can't add 1 topping to a cheese slice. WTF?
author: Anya W.

description: My ABSOLUTE FAVORITE pizza place! I've been a fan of their Pesto pizza for probably 20 years! Soooo goood! The pesto with potatoes and garlic is nice and more filling if you're pretty hungry!
author: Bridgette H.

description: I'm always wary of any pizza places on the west coast who either claim to be New York style pizza or include it in their name. However, this is the closest to NY style I've found in the Bay Area and every time has been deliciously awesome. I've only ordered online through their site, but each time has been an efficiently quick process and their employees have always been friendly. Highly recommend for those needing a pizza fix in the Financial District
author: Caroline T.

description:
Melted, warm cheese with sliced up sausage, this pizza is yummy!  Crust is nicely fluffed up and not on the dry side. 

Their spring mix salad was good - olives and dried cranberries are plusses for me.  They don't use homemade dressing, but packaged ones.  That's a letdown.

A guaranteed good slice of pizza with salad!

Their delivery is a reliever!
author: Tiffany D.

description: I like this place... and I'm picky when it comes to pizza. Over priced, yes, but so is everything else around here. My big problem with it is that I've tried to go get some pizza twice on Saturday afternoons and both times they haven't been open, although the hours on their window would suggest they should be. I hate wasting time. I HATE IT. Either be open when you say you are or don't say you'll be open. It's frustrating.
author: Nick D.

description: When it's heated up it just warms the bottom mostly, the cheese didn't melt for me. But it still tasted good. I'm sure I could have asked for it to be in there longer. $7 and change for a medium drink and LARGE slice of pizza is a pretty decent deal. Come at happy hour for a cheaper piece. I have to give them credit for grabbing the biggest piece from the pie for me too. And it wasn't the end slice, she didn't even ask she just gave me the biggest one. Thumbs up there! ;) it makes you feel like you stretched your dollar.
author: Sarah M.

description:
I've been eating at Escape From New York a lot lately and realized the 3 Stars from my previous review doesn't really do it justice. 

The staff is really friendly and silly and always lets me choose which slice of pizza from the tray I want (because I'm a huge pizza diva), they have beer on tap or in bottles for a nice little lunch beer, plus happy hour ($2.50 beers? Oh my!). Indoor and outdoor seating, and a TV so you can watch Ze Germans beat Brazil (sorry Brazil).
author: Crystal C.

description:
Okay fine. The mushroom slice I had today was actually pretty good. Thin and crispy with a good amount of red sauce. It was unlike most slices I've had since moving from NY. 

Keep doing the basics right and people will come back, including the EC transplants!
author: Phil C.

description:
PROS: 
- Combos are fantastic: favs are Miss Figgy, You Say Potato or Big Applewood Chicken 
- Cheap slices and pints: $3 pints and slices during 4-6pm Happy Hour
- Big screen TV: great low-key spot in FiDi to catch games without dealing with an overcrowded bar.
- Quick delivery: pies delivered, fast and fresh

CONS: 
- Pizza is best warm: something molecular happens after the cheese cools
- Closed Sundays: sorry no NFL marathons here
author: Nash R.

description:
First impression when you walk in, is that of dust. Thick, dirty dust covers the walls. 

Second, there are cases of soda and other things that they haven't taken in the back and take up room in the dining area. 

Third, on the opposite side of the restaurant is, a pile of what looks like old broken chairs and other such garbage.

Ordering is very easy and the staff very friendly. The pizza is the best around.

After you get your slice please get a napkin before picking up the greasy, dirty shakers for your cheese and peppers.

Grab a few more napkins because even though the lunch rush may be long over no one wants to wipe down the tables or seats. If you are in a suit please don't sit down.

As I was leaving a young woman brought back her beer because her glass had crud on it.

It'll be a while before I return. Too bad too because the, "You say potato" is one of the better slices in town.
author: Justin S.

description: This pizza is great, but they literally close as soon as they possibly can even if you get there right at 7:30. They're rude about it even though they have a ton of pizza sitting in the window or they wont make you the pizza you want if it's close to 30mins before they close. I'm in the Industry and in my book that's really poor customer service. Maybe they don't want business because they make it VERY clear that they all want out of there minutes before closing. Even if you offer to pay cash to buy the pizza they have sitting in the window they'll tell you 'sorry the register is gone' and that's literally at 7:31. This is the 3rd time this has happened to me and honestly it's not cool. Sorry the pizza is great but very poor customer service. :(
author: Mira M.

description: This is the best pizza ive had in California period. This is coming from a native new yawker. Only minus is that it cost $12 for two slices and a snapple. Its not new york pizza but its pretty damn close.
author: Matthew L.

description:
I'm quite confused looking at these pictures of awesome looking pizza...because their pizza doesn't look like that. Like all of the other EFNY locations I've been to in the city, they skimp on toppings. They have the weakest mushroom slice I've ever had. Weak on mushrooms. Weak on cheese. Another strike against em: they don't have a decent veggie slice. I'm not a vegetarian, but I love veggie pizza. They don't have a "veggie slice." They have a greek type thing, and they sometimes have a pesto slice, and the aforementioned weaksauce mushroom. I could imagine this would be a pain for someone who actually is a vegetarian. The slices that include meat also tend to be skimpy, and they have the floppiest crust, ever.

They get a meh. A big fat "meh."
author: Kelsey S.

description:
Great New York style pizza !  Hand tossed with fresh mozzarella , pepperoni sausage and the slices are worth every bite !  
Great customer service friendly !  
The constant flow of people says a lot as it shows just how good the pizza subs and salads are !   It's a must when ever on Bush street in downtown Financial district of San Francisco !  Great happy hour from 4-6 pm and the prices are great !   You won't be disappointed here !
author: ric L.

description:
They serve some hearty thin crust pizza which are good for the heart metaphorically but probably not too good for the heart literally. No pizza is but we love it right. Everything in moderation and you will be fine.

 I really enjoyed the pear garlic and the pepperoni meatball.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Tried a slice of the pesto chicken pizza: hearty, flavorful and cheesy.

I have faith this place can fulfill your pizza cravings. =)
author: Suji C.

description:
Get FIGGY with it!! Seriously, try the MISS FIGGY PIZZA. Smoked bacon, caramelized figs, fresh arugula, and goat cheese topped with a balsamic glaze...what's not to love? I am a huge fan of the sweet and tangy flavor of this particular pizza.

A close second would be the MARGHERITA PIZZA because it's loaded with lots of minced garlic (vampires beware!) for a nice kick of flavor that blended well with the fresh tomatoes, basil, and mozzarella. 

I wasn't wowed with any of the pizzas that had BBQ chicken (too dry) or sausage combo (very average).

The crust here is thin, chewy, and fluffy in the edges. I found myself actually wanting to eat the crust and not tossing it aside.

My work ordered 4 pizzas in for lunch and they delivered fairly quickly. I also want to stop by the physical location soon to try the happy hour and any of their pesto pizzas.
author: Bonnie Z.

description:
The pizza itself is amazing.

The customer that I receive from the men that work there were great, super friendly, and chill.

However, I guess I came in during an off day. A female cash register seemed inexperienced and didn't know how to properly ring me up. I ordered a MEDIUM half pesto and half pepperoni pizza. And the total was nearly 29 dollars! Til this day, I don't know if that was the correct price (because it wasn't noted anywhere in the restaurant) But it most definitely doesn't reflect the prices they have here on Yelp! Even if that was the cost, don't you think that's a bit expensive for a pizza? 

It's still good but I think I'm just going to pass for now on...
author: Ida H.

description: Bought two slices of pizza here, THEY TASTE UNFRESH, Like it's been sat for more than 6 hours. It taste like CARDBOARD, and hard because they didn't reheat enough. My pizza was cold, cheese was hard. The combination only have 3 toppings, that's it? You called that combination?
author: U T.

description: I just got back from napa and trying to cure a hangover I was in much need of pizza. this place was by my hotel and i stumbled in. HUGE slices and fucking tasty as well.
author: Rick S.

description:
My "go-to" for the dreaded lunch time indecision.
When in doubt - go pizza and this is as consistent as it gets. 
The only surprise i get from them is trying something new, never a doubt on quality.

I always know what i'm getting:
a) good, fresh ingredients
b) crisp, tasty, hand-tossed crusts 
c) just the right amount of cheese
d) just the right amount of spice

Keep it on your list if you're working in the area.

Glad they're here.
author: Hans H.

description:
Ha, I had no idea this was a chain or am I wrong? I saw a lot in the search results.

I stumbled upon this place because my friends cousin's band was playing a show here last Saturday night!

I have never been around so many punk rock hipsters in my life. I have nothing against them, but its obvious they are identifying themselves as such. Anyways that was because of the show that night.

They offered some pretty gourmet variations of the pizza by the slice. Overall it was just fine. They get points for creativity, but execution, overall flavor, and satisfaction was just okay. I would probably never eat here again not because it was horrible but if your in SF and you have 100+ options why go for mediocre?

Props for serving 16oz Trumer Pills for $4 in SF, that was nice.
author: Drew P.

description: Really like those place! This will now be my GO TO pizza joint. I came here because I hear about the pesto pizza. I ordered a slice for $4.50 (which is not bad for SF) it was a good slice. OMG was it delicious! I walked out of that place a happy camper. The place was very clean and roomy as well. This is a good place for pizza.
author: Rich C.

description:
I just realized that I still have my EFNYP frequent diner card, but had not written a review. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/escape-from-new-york-pizza-san-francisco?select=CM_d5TBryWE0OYNHNpZz2g#CM_d5TBryWE0OYNHNpZz2g Although I did post my pics back in 2008. Better late than never. LOL!

For many years, it was in my lunch rotation list. Here's my pic of the popular "u say potato" pizza. http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/escape-from-new-york-pizza-san-francisco?userid=8Ces6YdT6j7BYycnZLrSng#j4jnSFYvuT058aO8LDbUPQ In my opinion, quality has declined a bit over the years, so those who read old reviews expecting to be impressed might be disappointed. 

All the chain locations are a little different. For example, this place serves the FiDi lunch crowd so it's only open weekdays, they have many salads and there's plenty of seating space (inside and outdoors), http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/escape-from-new-york-pizza-san-francisco?select=Mzmy5ygEhRM5sdBzKpcW1A#Mzmy5ygEhRM5sdBzKpcW1A but doesn't stay open late like other locations.

Hours: M-F 9:30am-7pm
author: Luis C.

description:
The mechanism of developing a hack is to first understand the established system and then proceed via a minority method that provides specific advantages for self-benefit. This applies when seeing through walls in a video game, reheating leftover pizza in a waffle maker, or chaining hangers together to preserve closet space. The available hack at Escape from New York Pizza is simple and richly rewarding.

Assuming you are uninterested in battling the throngs that evacuate at noon, you must resort to choosing between cold and limp orphaned slices that populate the trays at the beginning and end of lunchtime. Instead of pining for a better pie while chewing through a stale crust, simply identify which pizza is not represented on the trays and ask if that combination is coming out from the oven soon. At this point, you will be informed of a wait time and be guaranteed a fresh slice in return for your patience.

Biting into the piping hot slice overloaded with cheese and toppings quickly erase any memory of the minor wait. You are even given an oversized slice to compensate your sacrifice. You Say Potato is definitely Escape from New York's signature slice.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Pretty good pizza. I definitely like the Pesto and Cheese pizza when I want a little flavor on my pizza.

I want to try a custom pizza but it's usually too packed and I'm on my lunch break so maybe one day out of the weekend I will for sure.

Will definitely recommend this for someone looking for a quick bite to eat or they just need something to grab and take back to the office real quick.
author: Brian J.

description: Pizza by the slice place. Pretty good with a nice outside sitting area. Also a bar so you can eat as well as get a beer. Definitely beats Blondies in my opinion.
author: Mike S.

description: The found the pizzas ok! Not that great but its ok! Did not really enjoy the vibe and the pizzas were pre cooked and went cold.  But like the service it was quick and fast.  The payment was also done really smoothly. They accept all major cards.  Soda is limited refills.  They have water dispenser.  The ambience is a bit low lit not a great time in evening.  Rush hours vary i visited at 7 pm and it was very crowded and noisy.
author: Yash S.

description:
Healthy escape.

Parmesan chicken is usually served breaded. Asking nicely and have a nice staff got me a custom grilled version with plenty of marinara sauce on a roll. So good.

Includes a bag of chips with the $9 price. Good luck having room. Sandwich is that big and you won't want to miss a bite.

You also won't want to miss this delicious escape.
author: Jason B.

description:
One of the best lunch places in the financial district for under $5.  This SF chain consistently produces the best to-go slices in the city.  The slices are a bit pricey ($3- $4.25 for a slice), but occasionally there is a coupon for a buy one get one free slice, which is an amazing deal.  

They usually have 6-7 options for slices including the typical pepperoni, hawaiian, vegetarian, etc. but I highly recommend getting their Big meat combo (sausage, bell peppers, onions) or the U Say Potato (roasted potato and garlic over pesto pizza) slices.

A bonus of this location is that there is plenty of seating inside as well as patio seating outside of the restaurant which is great on sunny days. They have a happy hour special (4pm-6pm? )for $2.50 cheese or pepperoni slices and beer specials.  This location also has beer on tap as well.
author: Ryan C.

description: Ordered a large BBQ chicken pizza (BBQ sauce, BBQ chicken and bacon), medium cheese pizza and medium gourmet pizza (vegetarian - artichoke, feta and sundried tomatoes) with a large caesar salad and large spring mix for a group of 9 people.  It was the perfect amount of pizza (we had 3 extra slices of the BBQ pizza) and we could have done with one less salad.  Everyone loved the pizza and they delivered it right on time.   Great experience.  With some soft drinks it cost about $98 before tip.
author: Vivian W.

description:
Huge thin slices of pizza. Sierra Nevada, corona and Heineken beers in bottles. Anchor, lagunitas and one other beer I forgot on tap

Good people watching from the window facing seats. 

Nothing super special but a nice spot to get some work done or grab a quick bite to eat

Would come back if I'm back in the area
author: Beini S.

description:
A million years ago, I used to love the EFNY on the upper haight. The pizza was simple, and good. And it tasted like authentic NY style crust. I haven't been to that one since then.

The FiDi version is ok, but it really tries too hard. It makes a good pie, with a great crust, but it really tries too hard with it's exotic offerings. The basics are great-but things like potato pesto with garlic? Yeah, it's a neat concept and sometimes concept pizzas work-but not here. 

You want a cheese, or a veggie, or a peperoni, or any other pizza staple? This is a great place. But if you go in expecting some exotic flavor to take your breath away-something about it just takes away from the experience. What's sad is that I'm sure producing all the weird ones takes away from the pizza staples.
author: Steve A.

description:
These hot triangles of glory have satiated my rumbling tummy many a time. I'm surprised that I have yet to pay my Yelp tribute to them, so here it goes! 

You'll get the same steamy cheesey excellence at any location, but this one has helped me out the most. They are wonderfully receptive to huge delivery orders - the size that would make a pizza-mongering megladon crave something different, like, a nice salad; so they have my catering standards met. 

On top of that, their website offers a beautifully simple yet comprehensive way to order online. I used to call and probably scare the pants off whoever answered the phone - "Hi, my name is Chelsea, and I need to order 114 pizzas please.....yes, 114." Now, I can avoid that by going online and wreaking havoc on the interwebs. 

Many will tout the magnificence of the You Say Potato, and I am here to not surprise you. That combination of un-skimped pesto, potatoes, and obese pieces of garlic is truly a winner. I will also speak for the other pesto related combinations - the one with tomatoes and mushrooms is darn tasty. 

Crust crust crust - this is the tipping point where people's pizza opinions can be determined. EFNY's crust is a happy medium that can please eaters of both the thick crusted and thin crusted preferences. It's crispy and cooked enough to tickle the thinnies, and full and doughy enough to tickle the thickies. 

I may have had better sauce-speriences in the pizza department, but the sauce is another one of those pizza opinion dividers. Anyway, this is a dependably delicious pizza option. Get on over.
author: Chelsea B.

description:
So I can't say that Escape From New York has the best pizza, or even really good pizza. The pizza is good, and I'll definitely visit again, but it's not great. 

The 5 star rating is really based on my experience today. There was a sizable group of us (10 or so) and we crammed into a couple of tables which we were lucky to find. We ordered a couple of pizzas which came out very quickly. We ordered some sodas and discovered that they were flat (no carbonation). The staff informed us that they were changing the tank, and them a couple of minutes later, they came to the table with fresh beverages. I fully expected to have to go to the counter to get my own freshened beverage. 

I kind of surprised myself for giving 5 stars to Escape From New York, but I guess it's the little things (like proactively bringing out fresh beverages) that go a long way for me. Seems silly now that I am reading my own review, but the rating stands...
author: Jeff C.

description: From Chicago where contrary to popular belief we love our thin crust (deep dish is for tourists).  It was after 10pm on a Sunday so options were limited. Ordered delivery, ingredients were fresh, service great and delivered quickly. The woman who took my order suggested going with sausage rather then pepperoni as they have a great sliced home original type and she was right on.
author: Tom B.

description: Last month I find out that my temp job assignment was ending (sad face).  I wanted to leave with a happy face and have a happy hour lunch with my then co-workers.  I ordered a huge 'Glorious Chicken' pizza with white sauce plus some buffalo chicken wings.  Fantastic pizza, the chicken wings weren't so bad either, but oh that pizza.  Delivered pretty quickly and it was enough for everyone in the office.  Loved it.
author: Emy B.

description:
I had a slice of the fig, bacon, cheese,and some sort of balsamic reduction. It was fantastic 

The pepperoni slice was also very good

It would be nice if they listed all the pizza slices available for the day because you have to  ask what's on each one when it's your turn and the server really didn't seem to know.  And it holds up the line.
author: Foodlover B.

description: Just your average slice of pizza.  Crust was kinda crispy.  It was aight.
author: Raj G.

description: Best pizza in town in my opinion. Affordable, nice people, and the food is consistently amazing! They have a punch card: 7 slices and the 8th is free (which makes it even more affordable). They have the most important SF brew on tap (Anchor Steam)! I have been coming here for over a year now and I have yet to have a bad experience. Their employee Vincenzo always has a smile on his face and makes sure that customers get exactly what they need; he exemplifies what great customer service requires. It seems there is a real cohesion with all of his coworkers, and that's what makes a team! I will not stop coming here as long as I am in SF and even if I move away, I would definitely make it a point to enjoy a HUGE slice of New York style pizza. Whoever owns this place knew exactly what the Financial District needed in the way of pizza and service, hats off to ya.
author: Jason C.

description: Slices here are great but why did it take over two hours to deliver 2 pies a mere 5 blocks away. I called to check their progress before the stated delivery time and even then they quoted me at 15 min later than expected. The meeting I ordered these for had been over an hour before they finally showed up.
author: Janelle J.

description: Pretty good pizza downtown.  Gets pretty crowded at lunch, but plenty of seating outside and indoors.  Personally, think it's a bit pricey for what it is, but it IS San Francisco.  I wish they'd heat their slices a bit more - after all, cold pizza's great, piping hot pizza is better, but lukewarm is...meh.
author: Angela R.

description:
Burnt the hell out of my tongue, but the pizza was good. Nothing amazing pizza-wise, but at the price it's exactly what you paid for. Definitely one of the cheapest options I've found downtown so far!

Be sure to walk past 333 __street it's on__ (the office building) as it's wrapped around the corner. Servers seemed a bit disgruntled but were quick.
author: Jack D.

description: I live pizza, finding great NY style pizza on the west coast is hard to come by but this place is great!! Give them a try!
author: Mike P.

description:
We got in 15 min before they were going to close on Saturday...at 4:45!!! What the...?! So weird for a place that is supposed to have happy hour from 4PM-6PM to close at 5 on a Saturday.
Its basically a pretty decent sports bar-type place. There's beers and wine as well as pizza. A good-sized place for the location it's in.
The pizza was alright and the pinot grigio was...meh.
author: Avril N.

description:
Exactly like Pizza My Heart.  I was actually on my way to fancy La Mar on Embarcadero but my stomach was already asking to be fed so I stopped by here on the way.  I split half a slice with my coworker and that was just enough, maybe a little more than enough, to hold me over.  I would imagine that an entire slice would be plenty for a meal.

They're nice people here.  I had picked a slice and the girl was just about to put it in the oven when I saw another more appetizing, more fresh slice and she was totally fine with switching it.  

Not much to say about it but that when you need greasy food in your stomach, this is the place to go to.  It's totally for business peeps on a tight schedule.
author: Shannon L.

description:
I like NY style, thin crust pizza.  I also like being able to just get 1 or 2 slices at a time, or be able to get 2 slices with different toppings without having to spend $20+ on a whole pizza.

This place is convenient to my office in downtown and very quick, which allows me to grab a bite to each at times that I normally would have just had to miss lunch and starve.  Once in a while, I even pick up a couple of extra slices for my wife and kid on the way home.  Have I had better pizza before?  Yes, but it's hard to find this style of pizza in San Francisco, where every pizza place insists on making fancy "gourmet pizza" and this place is easy with reasonable prices.
author: Buddha B.

description: Pizza's are not bad. Recommend the pesto or just pep. Don't get chicken wings they are from frozen wings.
author: Larry L.

description:
Good pizza. Has a great flavor in the sauce and lots of cheese. 

It's crazy cheap at happy hour (4-6pm) and there is also cheap beer if you're into that. I would not recommend the salads here, just stick with the basics. 

All the pizza is good, the combo, pepperoni, and garlic potato are all amazing. 

If you are starving after work because you missed lunch or something, go here for happy hour and get a couple slices and you will love it. Promise. 

** they have a little green loyalty stamp card, which is cool, too.
author: Alanna R.

description: Environment and area is neat.  We ate outside on the outdoor tables.  Ordered pepperoni slice and salad.  Pizza was okay and salad was small.
author: Andrea P.

description:
So close to my work that I could spit on it.  Not that I would b/c I have no problems with this place at all.  They have some very interesting combos.  I go here once in a while for their "happy hour"  they have discounted slices for $2.50 a slice ( I believe).  They also have bottled beer for cheap ($3 I think).  They also have a big screen that usually has sports on.  They also have outdoor seating which is nice on warm days.

Give them a try.
author: Ty C.

description: The pizza was ok. The salad was ok. The service was ok. The atmosphere was ok. I say why go here with so many options in SF?
author: Ira P.

description: Escape from New York offers some pretty solid pizza!  We often get catering  from here for my company, and I've always been a big fan.  Their pizza has great crust, tons of flavor, and just the right about of sauce and toppings.  They also have some pretty unique pies, all of which I've been a fan of.  Very solid choice for a good slice of pizza in the FiDi.
author: Zach S.

description:
This pizza was definitely not the best. It was cold and not filling at all, and it was rather pricey for the size of the slice. 

The hours are great though, as this place was open, when I actually wanted to go to the burger place nearby.
author: Tanya A.

description: Came here for breakfast on the recommendation of a Peet's employee. We got the breakfast burrito & the bacon egg & cheese on an English muffin.  Both were fantastic & their homemade ranch dressing was just as good as I remember my grandma making!
author: Talmage D.

description:
My company has brought in pizza from here on numerous occasions. They have a great variety to satisfy any taste.  And. It. Is. Goooood! 

My absolute favorite is the You Say Potato. OMG. I never knew pizza could be like that!  Due to my very small stomach i'm only able to barely finish one slice. But every bite is savored and swooned over.

I've never been disappointed, nor have i seen anyone at work disappointed either!  We get very excited when we see it's pizza from EFNY.

I will emphatically suggest this place for pizza anytime.
author: Char B.

description:
What I Ate
- Barbecue chicken bacon pizza

Would I Go Again?
This is the third time I've ordered Escape from New York Pizza for office lunches, and that barbecue chicken bacon pizza will keep me coming back.  Let's begin on the edge of the pizza and work our way in:

The crust
- not doughy, but definitely chewy...it's a fantastic part of the pizza, not just a burnt piece of dough that you hold in the hand and then toss in the garbage.

The sauce
- wonderful mix of barbecue and cheese...it's not too cheesy, and the barbecue doesn't dominate.  Very complementary.  

The protein
- bacon is wonderful--thick, juicy, and plentiful.  
- chicken is okay.  It's a bit more dry than the bacon, but it doesn't decrease the pizza-eating experience...it just doesn't overly enhance it.

For barbecue chicken pizza, Escape from New York Pizza is my favorite place in SF!
author: Ben M.

description:
Pizza was stale and worse off. Overcooked, you could taste that the sauce was old as it had that "off" flavor to it

The pizza crust literally turned to dust when I bit into it.   
Nice crew who works there but the pizza blows and anyone who's eaten it here and said its great....
1. Obviously has no idea what good pizza is 
2. Is from San Francisco (see 1)
author: Dean M.

description:
Okay, so I can't say this is the best pizza place, but every once in a while, they have the right combination of sauce, cheese, crisp dough, and savory toppings... THE GOURMET (Fresh Spinach, Feta Cheese,
Sundried Tomatoes & Artichokes)

We order here for delivery/take-out for lunch at my office.  They're pretty fast with service.  And people are friendly for delivery.  (Take-out...it's a zoo at lunchtime, which I've been subjected to attending twice and won't repeat it a third time.)

Their salads suck as who knows how long the 'veggies' have been in the containers, and while the description may sound nice for each different salad...they are bland! 

Prices = expensive.  

Overall, order here for pizza delivery.
author: Fannie S.

description: The service was good and the pizza was good - maybe not excellent, but it satisfied my NY pizza craving and was great for kids.
author: M L.

description:
It's not as good as most New York style pizza, but it's pretty good.  You really can't find the great NY pizza in San Francisco.
I do love their potato and pesto pizza, but I rarely see it.
I am definitely coming back here, it's one of the best that you can get in the city.
author: Krysten W.

description: Escape From New York is a great place to devour a piece of pie! Conveniently located in the Financial District, I like to step out of the office and walk over. There is normally not a long line and if there is, it goes fast. A big pro in my book is the crust. It is very crispy and thin, never burnt. The only thing I would change is the selection. Every once in awhile I don't see any good choices. Luckily cheese and pepperoni are always available.
author: Allison W.

description:
Awesome Pizza!! Buffalo Chicken is my favorite choice.

Thank you to Jessie who was delivery to a local building and directed me here. It was exactly what i was looking for.

Great food & service. Can't go wrong.
author: Jacob D.

description: Pretty mediocre pizza. They burned it the first time through and gave me two new slices, but the pizza was still not too special.
author: William S.

description: The You Say Potato is awesome and the portions are huge. One slice of pizza is plenty to hold me for a while. they have some other flavor combinations that look delicious as well. All that being said, I can't help but feel that it's missing something. I don't get that insane pizza feeling that I do when eating at the tip-top spots but I couldn't put my finger on what exactly. Still, a solid, delicious place but with all the amazing pizza joints in SF, they have stiff competition.
author: Madeline S.

description: This pizza is pretty good, i ordered a slice of the meat lovers pizza...it had a thin, crunchy crust, the right amount of sauce and cheese, and some really good sausage. Location is great for workers in the area...parking sucks...and the workers in there werent exactly customer service oriented...they looked like they hated it there. But i gotta say a pretty damn good pizza
author: Jeff C.

description:
Get the pesto potato pizza! It is absolutely heavenly. There are huge chunks of garlic and thinly cut potato slices upon pesto mozzarella. The slices are generous as well.

On the weekends, they have trivia which is fun to do with a group of friends.
author: R. K.

description:
You Say Potato pizza is topped with sliced and roasted potatoes & roasted garlic cloves over pesto sauce.

You Say Potato
Is oh so delicioso
even though
it makes your breath a big no-no.

Quick delivery; the pizza was still hot and yummy!  But, then again, we were only a few blocks away at 1 California.
author: Christina L.

description: Dude this has to be one of the best pizza places in SF. I was up there a few times for work and this was my go to spot for a quick bite. I only really ate the cheese or pep. Mainly cheese. They will warm it up for u and u are just ready to go. I was able to make it for happy hour which makes each slice like $2.50 I believe so it was even nicer and they serve beef and always have a game playing! Chill spot to say the least.
author: Wil S.

description: Waited 90 minutes for a truly disappointing pizza. I mean really average. I think there's a million other places to get better pizzas from.
author: Sally S.

description: Okay - so I generally come here for You say Potato - which is fantastic. That said all their pies are really good. Last week, in a rush I grabbed a Miss Figgy. New favorite - just excellent blend of flavors and textures.
author: Dennis F.

description: Open late with great pizzas and beer.  I was shocked to get a deal on a slice and good on tap brew in the city.
author: Bryan B.

description: Escape from NY Pizza is my favorite pizza in SF, hands down. I practically lived off their pesto pizza during a stint of vegetarianism in my college days! This location is close to where I stay when visiting SF so I usually hit it up at least once. In addition to the pesto, I am partial to the You Say Potato - sliced potato and garlic on pizza is genius. Bonus star for $2 beers during happy hour.  You know you want to have a couple of Anchor Steams with that :)
author: Lyn P.

description:
Got the small combo
Maybe I'm just hungry but the first slice disappeared so fast

Thin crispy delicious I was at first shocked there wasn't any ranch.....BUT IT Didnt matter

Now working on the salad it feels like a consolation prize.... Must repress urges to buy another........

and don't forget the slices happy hour makes it cheaper
author: Daniel K.

description: After living in New York for 19 years My husband and I are always in search for SF pizza that can measure up. This pizza is pretty darn good. We had pepperoni and margarita. The margarita was a little dry but there's plenty of basil and that's my favorite. The pepperoni was a little greasy but the red sauce was good. It's hand tossed and the crust was thin. Overall we thought it was pretty good.
author: Nicki D.

description:
Maybe a bit expensive for pizza but it's in the average at the financial district. Crust could also be a little more crispy. 

Other than that, it's delicious. Try the ones with chicken toppings you won't be disappointed
author: Ben L.

description:
Going to a restaurant or using a service on at least two occasions before I write a review is the right thing to do. Everyone can have an off day. Everyone deserves a second chance. That's part of being fair to the business, to myself and to the people who read my reviews on Yelp.

I've gone here twice in the past two weeks, and was dissatisfied both times. I didn't find the staff to be user friendly. Today I asked the staff member not to make my slices too hot, but they came out much hotter than I would have preferred, and I had to wait for them to cool during a truncated lunch break. Once the temperature was to my liking, the slices were only so so. On my previous occasion I had the temerity to stand in the wrong place and place my order with the wrong person, and was admonished for doing so by another staff member. Then I didn't hear a "thank you," not even a plastic one, when I paid. That's inexcusable. The tenor of the times demands, if for only economic reasons, that people maintain the veneer of gratitude and civility. Of course, I would prefer that people would come from a more loving, gentler place. 

I believe we have an investment in and a commitment to each other. Kindness costs nothing and says everything. If a business does not afford its staffers the opportunity to sincerely thank its customers then it is either poorly run, inadequately staffed, improperly trained or its priorities are off kilter. A woman I admire and respect says it best for me when she stated "each time you buy something you get to vote." I don't like the way I'm treated here.

I think I'll take my vote somewhere else.
author: Michael J.

description: Sometimes I order pizza for my office from Escape From NY, and they are always SO NICE.  And I like the food too.
author: Needles K.

description:
Its sucks the fact that they have to grab your pizza with their bare hands!!!!! 

otherwise the Pizza is great wish I could give a more stars but those  those BARE HANDS all over my PIZZA is disturbing!!

Wish the owner or MGR reads this and does something about it.  
they grab your pizza than the person c.c or cash.


The one on (333 bush st) I go there for lunch all the time...
author: Abraham D.

description:
I've had this pizza before....day old and cold and it was delicious.
This time I got it warm and with ranch dressing on the side. EVEN BETTER. I love this pizza. I think it's the best pizza I've ever had. I have actually been craving it so much that I checked if they would deliver to Berkeley :)
Why not 5 stars? The price.
author: Cesie A.

description:
Really good New York-style pizza.  I've been a fan for a while and some of my favorites include the Potato Pesto, Cheese and Hawaiian pizzas - they are all thin-crust with a lot of flavor.  A slice I'd never had before was an Italian Sausage, which was fantastic - salty and slightly spicy...something you don't see on too many pizzas.

This is a great spot for a fast bite during lunch or if you're in a hurry for dinner.
author: Ken G.

description:
The food is okay, but the service is lacking. Most of the employees seem disinterested in their job, like they'd rather be anywhere else than behind a cash register. I know how that is, I've been there... but you have to put on a smile when you're working... that is how it is, even if it's difficult.

They also had more employees than they needed... or their employees weren't doing the work that they were being paid to do. They had 5 or 6 employees visible from the cash register, and most of them appeared to be talking with one another or on their cell phones.

The food is good, not the best ever, but I can't really judge the whole menu from one Italian sausage sandwich. However, the service was poor enough to give me second thoughts about visiting this location. If they worked a little harder and showed more effort, I would be more inclined to visit this establishment again.
author: Jesse R.

description: I have to say I've been having issues finding consistently good pizza in San Francisco and Oakland. Even the Escape from New York Pizza place in my old hood in the Haight wasn't that good. I'm from the east coast where you live and die by pizza and I just didn't understand how pizza could be bad. Anyway, I found this spot near my job and the pizza is passible, plus the chicken parm sandwich is pretty good too. So unhealthy and fast but GOOD! Thank goodness!
author: Ayele A.

description:
This is a great place to grab a quick and relatively cheap lunch (by FiDi standards).  The staff are friendly and the pizza is great.  They have some really tasty toppings - like artichoke hearts & sundried tomatoes or potatoes & pesto.  

They also do catering, which my company orders about once every two weeks.  We get 5-7 pizzas and a giant salad.  I'm pretty sure work attendance increases on pizza days :P.

As an added bonus, they now have beers on tap, wine & sangria to the menu.  Not really what you are looking for for lunch, but they are open later in the evening and offer a variety of activities like karaoke (Friday nights) and trivia (Thursday nights).  I haven't made it to any of the activities yet, but they look fun and are super close to my office.
author: Liz H.

description: I ordered the Elementary My Dear Watsonville and it was delicious & fresh. Delivery was speedy too. My only minus one star is that the delivery guy dropped it off at the next door office instead of following my instructions to knock on my door to deliver. Kinda weird, but it was still good. I'll order from here again.
author: Laura B.

description:
Escape from New York has pretty darn decent pizza, especially when you can get a fresh slice. Their garlic, pesto, and potato slice is delicious. I've also become a fan of their eggplant parmesan sandwiches. 

When Bistro Burger's lines are out the door, just come straight here and try their new sandwich menu additions.

Just be sure to save a little room for a frozen yogurt at Caffe Ambrosia on the way back to the office.

Honestly, on a nice day, when the lunch rush has worn off, and there's ample outside seating room: a hot Escape from New York sandwich, (maybe even a Corona :) ), and a fresh frozen yogurt - will make any day go by faster.
author: Jessica T.

description: It's hard to eat on the cheap out in the financial district especially if your a student. This place is what helps is beauty school students. Great pizza and so many to choose from. My friend always gets the you say potato and I love the mushroom since I'm a mushroom oholic. 3-4 a slice is nice! These slices aren't small at all! Big in fact so you get a huge bang for your buck!!
author: Nadia N.

description: I was looking for the bus when I stumbled upon this gem. I was hungry and decided to stop in for a quick snack. It was absolutely delicious. I was hard to order when I saw all the options of pizza they had. The staff was very fun and happy to serve. The enthusiasm was contagious and the slice was very scrumptious.
author: Bryant A.

description:
Pros:
* Best pizza in the fidi
*Fast service
* Outdoor seating for nice days
* Mini combo is a good deal

Cons: 
* "best pizza in the fidi" isnt saying much, but it's decent for anywhere
*nasty pigeons outside putting their nasty feet on the tables you eat on, though in 
fairness to the restaurant, this is a hard problem to control

and to the people who said that the employees are all pierced slackers, well yeah, they are. but im not sure how that affects your enjoyment of your pizza. they get their job done - it's not masa's
author: Erica W.

description:
- Good place for a slice to go if you're in the neighborhood.
- They have happy hour specials on pizza, wine and beer from 4-6pm on weekdays
author: Mary W.

description:
This pizza is above average in my opinion.
I really enjoyed the Watsonville. Tomato, Pesto, Arichoke Hearts.
Nice fresh salads.
Delivery- ONTIME!
author: Edi B.

description: I appreciate the quick delivery, friendly delivery guy & qty of pizza for the money. However, pizza was just ok for me.
author: Candace V.

description:
Even though I like the fact that you can order combos with salad and a drink at this location, the pizza is usually underwhelming.

I used to eat here once in a while when I worked a block away. Today I lunched here with an old co-worker of mine and the pepperoni slice I got was limp and had a lot of grease. His pesto slice didn't look too appetizing either.

I do like the Escape from NY location in the Haight, however. They seem to have consistently better pizza there.

If you REALLY need a slize of pizza in the FiDi then this place is convenient enough.
author: Art O.

description:
Wandered into this location since it was 1 block from my appointment.  Huge slices.  My fav is the Gourmet - Fresh Spinach, Feta Cheese, Sundried Tomatoes & Artichokes.  All the folks were friendly - cashier & manager who prepped my order.  

Tip:  They have a slice card - after 7 your 8th is free.
author: Kim S.

description: AWESOME!!!!!!!! Great service and excellent pizza! Had the gourmet slice and my girl had the pesto? Best I've had in a minute!
author: Justin G.

description:
I've eaten their pizza numerous times before, mostly thanks to impromptu office pizza parties.  Today was probably the first time I've eaten there.  A few co-workers and I had planned to go, and to ward off Friday doldrums, I perused the online menu at 8:30 this morning.  I do get that bored sometimes.

Long before I got there, I decided against pizza.  I am going to get the hot sub!  While standing in line, I thought about asking how long it would take, but the menu board suggests informatively: "It takes 3-5 minutes, but worth the wait!"  Well, if you say so.  The chicken parmesan hot sub that I got was delectable.  Bonus point: I thought the wait was no less than 3 minutes.

Pizza itself, based on past consumption (can I review based on future consumption??), is also quite scrumptious.  The BBQ chicken is reminiscent of CPK, and yet the crust has more bite than the think crust CPK offers.  Other types are just as delicious: potato, pesto, spinach-artichoke-sundried tomato-feta, etc.  Needless to say, I'm not a NY pizza purist.  Definitely Californian.  And that's why I escaped from new york, pizza!...  (Okay, that didn't make sense)
author: Yohanna B.

description: I'm from New York. Meh. Maybe for SF it's good pizza. Definitely better than area chains. And it's great they deliver late night to the financial district. It's decent pizza, but not NY standards.
author: Rae B.

description: The name pretty much says it...every pizza I've had is delicious and they give you a big slice.  My favorite part is the excellent service, everyone who works here is chill and make you feel welcome.  Also they have gluten free and vegan cheese if your into that sort of thing. Oh ya and they serve their own beer that is also very tasty.  Favorite pizza shop in San Francisco for sure!
author: Josh G.

description: Both times I've recently walked in for the happy hour deal ($2.50 pints and pepperoni slices) they have been pulling out a super fresh pepperoni pizza so I can't comment on cold slices or non-happy hour deals. With that said this place is a pretty phenomenal deal for an after work bite. $2.50 for a pint of Lagunitas IPA is the best deal I've found so far in the FiDi. The slices are pretty gigantic and filling, I usually get two and its plenty for dinner. Make sure to get a punch card, getting a free slice after you purchase 7 means essentially a free slice every 4th visit if you usually get two slices like I do. They have all the usual condiments such as italian seasonings, hot peppers and parmesan on hand, though hot sauce would be a welcome addition. 4 stars because although it's a good deal and tasty i'd feel pretty silly giving a place 5 stars for basic pepperoni pizza.
author: Gannon M.

description: Have been reading posts from ex-NY'ers claiming EFNY pizza is "meh"...they're wrong!  I'm an ex-NY'er (20 yrs in Manhattan/Bklyn) and definitely know my pizza and Escape does it right as far as I'm concerned.  Their dough is terrific..not too thin, not too thick..it folds just right and you don't lose any toppings in the process.  My faves are You Say Potato, Pesto and the Barbeque Chicken.  And considering the levels of pizza found here in SF...EFNY rocks!
author: Donna R.

description:
while not the best pizza in the world, probably the best pizza within 4+ blocks.

Why are the pizza places around union square/fidi so lame!?
author: Michael E.

description:
Updated to 4 stars 06/12/08

I'm bumping this review up a star because I tried the pizza again, it's been over 8 months since my first attempt. I even forgot that I didn't like their Hawaiian the first time. Today, I got a slice of Hawaiian, no soda (no extra calories needed please). It was crispy and the middle was perfect! No soggyness at all. If I weren't attempting to eat smaller portions I could have ordered another slice. I'm hungry just thinking about it. 

[Drinks Yogi tea to help me not be hungry.]

I will be back for sure to Escape From NY even though I've never been to NY before...yet.
author: Lorrie N.

description:
There pizza is excellent.  I've had it multiple times.  This location is closest to the financial district where I work.

I tried out their delivery service.  Despite the online ordering needing a visual/operations makeover, it worked perfectly.  I got my pizza delivered directly to my desk in 45 minutes (as they quoted).  Paid with my CC online, no problem.

I ordered the "U Say Potato" pesto pizza with extra grilled chicken. Yum!

I will be ordering again.
author: Dom D.

description: Crappy service, weird location, mediocre pizza. Everyone working there was high as a kite.
author: Timothy C.

description:
Most of us only came to here to booze ourselves up for the next party location.  If they keep having $2 beer's, you better believe it will increase there current business. 

Didn't eat the pizza,. but will try next time!  YAY to $2 beers!
author: Chanel L.

description: I'm a little baffled by all the four star reviews.  I've been here a number of times as it's conveniently located a block from work.  Honestly, I've been underwhelmed by the pizza.  Some of the selections are not too creative, not too tasty, and the crust tends to be a little too tough.  Maybe this place should not have escaped from New York.
author: Angel S.

description:
I'm definitely a fan of the pizza here! However, I do think they might be slightly more expensive than other quickie pizza places for picking up a slice or two.

I ate here last Friday, ordered 2 slices of pizza (the potato one and a slice of cheese) and ordered a drink, and the total was about $10. 

The potato pizza was definitely worth ordering! At first, when I chose my pizza, I worried that it wouldn't taste as great cuz it looked like it wasn't fresh out of the oven. But then I realized that they take the slices you order and bake it in the over for a bit. It definitely tasted like it was fresh-cooked!

If you eat here, sit at the bar stools along the window. You'll get a great view of the FiDi types walking past. Also, the Bank of America building is a nice thing to stare it (I suppose...).
author: Melissa D.

description:
1 Star for decent pizza
1 Star for the lunch combo with good salads
1 Star for reasonable prices
1 Star for the patio on a sunny day
author: Aaron M.

description:
I'll keep it simple here, folks:

- No, this doesn't resemble NY pizza in any of the ways that people talk about NY pizza.  The crust is not crisp at all, and is kind of soggy and thick.  The sauce is overly sweet and tomato-pasty (as so many NY pizzas are, come to think of it).  

- Yes, it's perfectly edible and satisfying the way so many other average pizzas are.  Satisfying and forgettable.

- Yes, you can probably do a lot better elsewhere.  But if your company is ordering in and giving it to you for free?  I'm not complaining...
author: Laurence W.

description:
BURNT CRUST IS A NO-NO!

I found myself eating at this place week after week for the convinence and short distances from the company I worked at. I've had much better pizza. Dislike the thin burnt crust but enjoy their salads.

Work-staff, please whipe down the tables? I know it's polite for the customers to throw away their trash but tables still need to be whipped down. And why must the tables be close to the uni-sex bathroom. Everytime the door flings open the fumes come pouring out and I feel like barfing as a scarf down my burnt crust pizza.
author: Jane A.

description:
I hate this location! The one in the Haight is so much better. 

Just soooooo rude. We walked out b/c they pissed us off that much.

Won't be back
author: Kevin M.

description: Their pizza is great! They come in huge slices. I would recommend the Pesto with potatoes and garlic. I'm not exactly sure what it's called but it is awesome.
author: Kirita S.

description:
So I work in the financial district - I take that back in the heart of the financial district and when its lunch time there are tons of places to hit.  I can say that this one I would hit more than once.  

This is your typical Pizzeria and at lunch there is always a line and for good reason.  Their pies are pretty tasty.  I recommend the Pesto Potato. Fresh and typically hot from the oven is of course always preferred!!  This place can get really busy during lunch so the best time is before the noon rush or after 1 pm.  I also really enjoyed their salads.  They are pre-made but I found them to be fresh.  This is for sure one of my favorite places to dash to at lunch.  Check them out.
author: Heidi S.

description: They just extended their happy hour and it now starts at 4pm, all beer and pizza slices $ 2.5!!
author: Nicolas S.

description:
Minus TWO stars to the cashier who blatantly rolled her eyes at me today. Let me say talking super fast and not above the range of noise made by the open kitchen doesn't mean to give me attitude because I didn't hear YOU right. I forgot to catch what pizza I ordered and I didn't hear her say "for two pepperonis I will get a small soda". Even my 10-year-old daughter noticed and was very taken aback by the cashier's attitude. 

So if the owners of Escape from NY Pizza read this: 

My transaction of $9.35 took place on 6/29/09 around 12:35pm on terminal #2 by a Hispanic woman whose name I didn't catch. Teach your employees some customer service AND patience ... and maybe I'll come back to your restaurant.
author: Jamie L.

description:
not the best location
ambiance is inexistent and pizza is fatty
but its satisfactory when you're starving
author: Tal S.

description:
This used to be my favorite pizza, but the last couple of times it hasn't lived up to it's previous quality. 

I noticed that each location seems different in it's crust thickness and amount of sauce they use.

The sauce is not as flavorful as Pizza My Heart or Pizza Orgasmica. 

This pizza place has probably dropped out of the top 5 of my favorite pizza places.
author: Chad O.

description:
Consistently great pie in FIDI.

Hands down the best in the area and they deliver within minutes of scheduled delivery time.

Potato Garlic Pizza- freakin amazing and it always goes quick in my office. Garlic is perfectly roasted and compliments the potato so nicely.

Gourmet with spinach, yes please and the Hawaiian... some of the very best I have had.

Well worth the calories and cholesterol.
author: Steve S.

description:
On a rainy evening I found that the eatery I wanted to try out was closed an hour before its stated closing time. Darn. With an empty belly I walked around the block to gleefully find an Escape' Pizza.

I've only been to the Escape' Pizza on Haight, so this location was quite different. It isn't as grungy nor nostalgic but rather more business-like due to the surrounding financial businesses. There are two poems on the wall that appear to be customizable. One Italian 'Escape from New York" poster hangs in the back along with an eagle architectural detail derived from the Chrysler building. Counter and table seating seats about 30.

The selection of pizzas for single slices was pretty good but I didn't see anything I wanted. After seeing my dissatisfaction they notified me that the pesto-potato and cheese pizzas were just about to come out. I opted for the dependably greasy pesto-potato.

Getting a hot slice straight out of the oven is like getting a donut straight out of the fryer. It was so satisfying! The cloves of garlic were melting in my mouth and the cheese was super elastic. Good thing I had gum with me. "Escape" sure came to the rescue.
author: Michael H.

description:
YUM great pizza!  I especially love the one with the artichoke... soooo good!  I seriously crave this place!  Nice order and go place.  Perfect if you work in the Financial District.

Price could be better but at least it's worth it!
author: Kay R.

description:
Probably the best pizza by the slice in the financial district. That's not really saying too much since their is a lack of good pizza but still good non the less. 

Reasonably priced and they have some beer specials too. Good place to grab a slice and sit out side with a beer.

Favorite Slice - Big Meat Combo (Sausage, Pepperoni, bell pepper and onions.) YES no mushrooms or olives.

Least Favorite - Potato Pesto. So greasy and heavy.
author: Jeff P.

description:
Yup, I'm a regular. When I can't decide what to eat, Escape it is.  The first time I tried this chain was the Castro location, and it was pretty good.  I come here often, and sometimes its better then others, but it does hit the spot.  Ofcourse, when the pizza pops out of the oven fresh, it's the best!

Definitely try out the Pesto and the You Say Potato pizzas... my two favs :)
author: Shafaq C.

description:
Why am I eating three enormous slices of pizza (2 potato pesto and one chicken veggie) at 3:30 p.m. just after finishing a decent lunch and mere hours before romantic date night out? Well. Let's see...
1. I'm now fully into the MS part of PMS 
2. I feel like an animal crawled inside of me and died
3. My Xanax wore off around 2 p.m. and I managed to leave the bottle at home.
4. Stuffing my face was my only alternative to curling up in the fetal position and sobbing over the injustices of my life and womanhood
5. Cutting myself makes me hungry

With that out of the way, I would like to say that this outpost is close enough to my office that I am guaranteed to burn almost NO calories on the walk back and forth to get my fix. Also, this is instant comfort for me and the staff there know that. They even give me sympathy glances and refill my extra large diet coke (the ONLY diet I'm on) after I inhale it all in one gulp while nervously pacing back and forth waiting for my slices to emerge from that hot, heavenly oven. Oh yeah! They're magicians, too. Even the gnarliest dried up, day-old, leatherface looking slices come out of that oven oozing warm cheese and glistening with grease like they were just made. Why do I care if it's not the best tasting pizza in SF? This is the Fidi and I'm a busy stress case- all I need is something warm and gooey to put in my mouth. And I need it fast. And I need it cheap.
author: Autumn K.

description:
Very very disappointed.  I'm a vegetarian and ordered cheese pizza.  There was some PEPPERONI under the cheese where I couldn't see it.  I took a bite of it and nearly threw up.  I've never seen such carelessness in any restaurant. 

I ordered the pizza to go, so I wasn't at the restaurant when I found the pepperoni but this is very very upsetting.  I'm never going back.
author: Mack D.

description:
I've never been to New York so I can't quite judge on the authenticity of this place's name--however I do know what I like and this I like.

However the biggest appeal for this place isn't that the pizza is (claimed to be) from New York, but that it operates on New York time.  Yes this is one of a few handful of places in the FiDi that one can get order food after the work day is over.  

Simply walk in, pick out what you like, and within a New York minute you'll have your slice fresh from the oven.  Throw in $2 bottled beers during "happy hour" and you have yourself quite a winner.

Now, let's bring over the concept of 24-hour bars to our lovely city..
author: Tien N.

description: I've had New York pizza in Manhattan and this is as close to it as I've had.  They have awesome choices and the style and flavor is very similar.  I'm not sure why New York pizza is soo good, but this place (for a chain) is pretty good itself and portions are huge! Will be back!
author: Joseph C.

description:
Judging by the other reviews I probably caught them on a bad day. Horrible service none the less. 

I go in and order a cheese slice and pepperoni slice. They hand me a luke warm cheese slice and tell me to wait a few minutes for the pepperoni. I wait and wait and see people who ordered after me get thier pepperoni slice with no problems. Finally the guy who helped me comes up and says they are out of pepperoni and if I want anything else. I order something else and they dont bother to warm it up so now I have an expensive piece of cold cheese pizza and an expensive piece of some other pizza both ice cold. The pizza is ok, the service is non-existent. The ordering system has to be the dumbest thing I have ever seen. I wouldn't waste my money again at this place....
author: Tom M.

description: This is a great place to grab a slice at the counter and contemplate the poem that fills up an entire wall of this restaurant. The potato pesto garlic pizza is particularly tasty; however, about three heads of garlic alone are on one slice. If you do get this, don't get anywhere near me afterwards. With the coupon in the SF Bay Guardian and SF Weekly, you can get a slice and a soda for $2.99.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
Good slice at a good price!

Came in during "Happy Hour" and got a slice of peperoni and a Sam Adams for two bucks each.  If I worked in the fidi, I think I'd probably hit this place up pretty often.
author: Rocco B.

description:
What A San Francisco Institution. Now This is My Kind of Pizza!!!  Gourmet Veggie sun dried tomato ...artichoke hearts heaven.  I have hit every escape location in San Francisco.  I see the owners hard at work making pizza taking up the slack.  This is a model hard working business.  I wonder how much $$$ moolah the Castro Street Location Lost in Food sales Halloween Castro 2007 ...aka RIP CASTRO the non-event 2007. Newsom you fool. You too Heather. ooops I digress.

Escape from New York Pizza contains only the finest ingredients. There is no artificial anything! We make our dough from unbleached flour, use whole milk mozzarella cheese, and our produce is fresh cut daily. You can taste the quality difference! Why do people eat Pizza Hut. That is just so wrong...so is Round Table....aaaargh!

Quick Poor Hungry Foodie in need of nourishment. Look in ANY SF WEEKLY....in the EATS/Food Section. There is always a coupon for a slice of pizza heaven and  a soda pop. All for $3.00 bucks and some change. I heart NY. Check out the NYC Big Apple Memorabilia. 

PEPPERONI
SAUSAGE
CANADIAN BACON
FRESH GARLIC
PINEAPPLE
EXTRA CHEESE
PESTO SAUCE
FETA CHEESE
JALAPEOS
ROASTED GARLIC CLOVES
BAR-B-QUE SAUCE
FRESH BASIL
APPLEWOOD
SMOKED BACON*
 MUSHROOMS
ONIONS
OLIVES
GREEN PEPPERS
TOMATOS
ARTICHOKES
SUNDRIED TOMATOS
ROASTED POTATOES
CHEDDAR CHEESE
ROASTED RED PEPPERS
FRESH SPINACH
BAR-B-QUE CHICKEN*
ROASTED CHICKEN*

YUM!!!!  They need to open an Escape in the OMI.West of Twin Peaks. Ho fame ora. I am hungry now!!! They don't even deliver this far out.  North Beach Pizza opened a outlet out here on Mission Street.  Powers that be @ Escape?  I think I am going to have to Twitter in the Owner's Ears.

Infodiva reppin' some good eats. damm I have the munchies now. hahaha Remember OMI Ingleside 94132. I do venture out into other neighborhoods sometimes. Dam there are 138 neighborhoods in San Francisco County. That is quite alot.  I love SF the Sco' I love Food. and Escape does it real good.

Ciao Chow
author: Infodiva B.

description:
At the first meeting of the California Italian-American Advocates Organization (CIAO, get it?  I didn't make this up, please don't punish me), they served us PIZZA!  And not that crappy nasty cheap-o crap-o soggy pizza.  They got delivery from Escape from New York!

There's suppose to be a reference to "attorney " or "law" or "lawyer" somewhere in the name.  Maybe.  If I get around to it, I'll look it up and, oh, it's "advocate."  Ok.  Changed.
